architectural_notes: Dark background with bright white (#FFFFFF) text for maximum contrast; orange accents retained

existing_features.title: In ServicesSection.tsx, set all text elements — section label ('WHAT WE DO'), section heading ('Our Services'), subtitle/description text, service card titles, service card description text, and feature labels — to bright white (#FFFFFF). These are currently rendering in a very dark color nearly invisible against the dark background.

In Layout.tsx (navigation header), set all nav link text — Services, About, Testimonials, Gallery, Contact — to bright white (#FFFFFF) with sufficient opacity (no gray or muted tones). The logo text and any other header text should also be bright white. This applies to the scrolled/white-background header state as well — either force the header to always remain dark-background, or ensure nav text is dark enough to be visible on a light background.

In AboutSection.tsx, set all text elements — section heading, all body/paragraph text, highlight card labels (Eco-Friendly, Precision Tech, Certified Team, Fast Turnaround) — to bright white (#FFFFFF). These are currently dark-colored and nearly invisible against the dark background.

Audit all remaining page sections — HeroSection, TestimonialsSection, GallerySection, BookingForm, ContactSection — and apply bright white (#FFFFFF) to any text that is currently using dark, gray, or muted colors that render poorly on a dark background. Ensure consistent maximum-contrast white text throughout the entire public-facing site.

projectName: Fix text contrast — bright white text across all sections
